result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy Thomas Parmeter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court assessed only the DNA surcharge in this matter.  Bond to apply and excess bond to be refunded to the poster.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leroy Thomas Parmeter

records.addlTxt: 02:26 PM Defendant, Leroy Thomas Parmeter, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Atty Pollak files PLQ.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak: def pleading G to Ct 1, Ct 2 DRI, joint rec for court costs.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 and orders a JOC; Count 2 is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes statement to the Court.  Court orders $500 fine inclusive of costs, to be taken from cash bond posted.  Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.  Court reconsiders, assesses only $200 DNA surcharge, waives the remainder.  Excess cash bond posted to be returned to bond poster.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:08 PM Defendant, Leroy Thomas Parmeter, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Discussion of request for Zoom made previously.  Case scheduled for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by court and parties- def pleading to Count 1 as charged; joint rec of costs only, DRI count 2.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Off the record 2:12 PM.  Back on the record 2:16 PM, same appearances.  Atty Pollak updates- def is no longer comfortable moving forward with the plea today.  Def to pay $200 additional by that date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:07 AM Defendant, Leroy Thomas Parmeter, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: agreement reached, plea/s date needed, recites offer: plead to Count 1 for court costs.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Def to prepay an additional $250 prior to next date.
Status conference on March 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

02:03 PM Defendant, Leroy Thomas Parmeter, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Def by phone.  All other parties in person.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
